medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed secondary sexual characteristics and bilateral non-palpable testes.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at an unspecified age with the diagnosis of bilateral migrating testes made at 3 and 7 years old. He experienced delayed development of pubic hair (Tanner Stage 1) and micropenis (Tanner Stage 2) was noted. Follow-up visits were interrupted until he was 15 years old. At 7 years old, his height was recorded at 105 cm, which was 2.5 standard deviations below the age-appropriate mean. The patient's symptoms showed deterioration leading to the need for further intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ear anomalies, hearing loss, mental retardation, short stature, posterior nasal atresia, patent ductus arteriosus, and bilateral migrating testes.
